Description: Small bronze male figure in Egyptian dress and pose; the man is standing with arms by his sides and left foot forward, slightly bent at the knee; prominent nose and out-sticking ears; he wears a kilt with a central panel and a belt with a horizontal groove on the front; on his head is a conical helmet with a small knob on top resembling the white crown of Upper Egypt; the figure is cast in lost-wax technique.
Curator's comments: See also Masson 1968, esp. 394(g) and fig. 20. Bibliography: Masson O. 1968, 'Kypriaka VII: Le sanctuaire d'Apollon à Idalion (Fouilles 1868-1869)', BCH 92, 386-402.
Bibliographic references: Reyes 1992 / The anthropomorphic statuettes of archaic Idalion (cat. no. 2, p. 245 & pl. 15(b))
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Robert Hamilton Lang
